title: Red
author: Taylor Swift
lyrics:
[00:15.28] Loving him is like driving a new Maserati down a dead end street
[00:21.15] 
[00:23.50] Faster than the wind, passionate as sin, ending so suddenly
[00:30.50] Loving him is like trying to change your mind
[00:33.26] Once you're already flying through the free fall
[00:38.74] Like the colors in autumn, so bright, just before they lose it all
[00:46.26] Losing him was blue, like I'd never known
[00:49.72] Missing him was dark gray, all alone
[00:53.35] Forgetting him was like trying to know
[00:55.95] Somebody you never met
[01:01.18] But loving him was red
[01:04.21] 
[01:09.17] Loving him was red
[01:12.10] 
[01:16.66] Touching him was like realizing all you ever wanted
[01:20.28] Was right there in front of you
[01:24.16] Memorizing him was as easy as knowing all the words
[01:27.32] To your old favorite song
[01:31.51] Fighting with him was like trying to solve a crossword
[01:34.55] And realizing there's no right answer
[01:39.24] Regretting him was like wishing you never found out
[01:42.78] That love could be that strong
[01:47.55] Losing him was blue, like I'd never known
[01:51.39] Missing him was dark gray, all alone
[01:54.92] Forgetting him was like trying to know
[01:57.48] Somebody you never met
[02:02.63] But loving him was red
[02:06.88] Oh, red
[02:10.25] Burning red
[02:13.23] 
[02:17.53] Remembering him comes in flashbacks and echoes
[02:22.17] Tell myself it's time now gotta let go
[02:25.77] But moving on from him is impossible
[02:28.75] When I still see it all in my head
[02:33.56] In burning red
[02:36.44] 
[02:41.26] Burning, it was red
[02:48.65] Oh, losing him was blue, like I'd never known
[02:52.96] Missing him was dark gray, all alone
[02:56.52] Forgetting him was like trying to know
[02:59.19] Somebody you never met
[03:04.33] 'Cause loving him was red
[03:07.25] Yeah, yeah, red
[03:11.84] Burning red
[03:14.63] 
[03:20.28] And that's why he's spinning 'round in my head
[03:24.33] Comes back to me, burning red
[03:28.52] Yeah, yeah
[03:31.52] 
[03:35.04] His love was like driving a new Maserati down a dead end street
[03:41.93]
